Get help if you're struggling to pay your council tax.

Contact us as soon as possible

Don't wait until you miss a payment. The earlier you get in touch, the more we can help.

We understand that people sometimes have money problems. We're here to help, not judge.

Call us on 01452 396396

How we can help

If you're having trouble paying, we can:

Set up a payment arrangement

We can agree a payment plan that fits your budget. You'll pay smaller amounts over a longer time.

Important: You must keep to the agreed plan. If you miss payments, we may have to take further action.

Check if you qualify for help

You might be able to get:

  • Council Tax Support - reduces your bill if you're on a low income
  • Discounts - like the single person discount if you live alone

Check Council Tax Support | Check discounts

Get advice on money and budgeting

Free advice is available from:

  • Citizens Advice - citizensadvice.org.uk
  • StepChange Debt Charity - stepchange.org
  • National Debtline - 0808 808 4000

What to tell us

When you contact us, it helps if you can tell us:

  • Your council tax reference number (on your bill)
  • Why you're struggling to pay
  • What you can afford to pay
  • Your income and essential spending

Don't worry if you don't have all this information. Just call us and we'll work through it together.

What happens if you miss a payment

If you miss a payment and don't contact us, we'll send you letters to remind you to pay.

The stages of enforcement

  1. Reminder notice - We'll remind you to pay. You usually have 7 days to pay or contact us.
  2. Final notice - If you still don't pay, you lose the right to pay in instalments. You must pay the full year's bill.
  3. Court summons - If you still don't pay, we'll apply to the magistrates' court for a liability order. You'll have to pay court costs too.
  4. Liability order - If the court agrees, we can use enforcement agents (bailiffs) to collect what you owe.

Don't ignore letters from us. It will only make things worse and cost you more money. Contact us and we'll try to help.

Enforcement agents (bailiffs)

If we have to use enforcement agents, they can:

  • Visit your home
  • Take your belongings to sell at auction
  • Take money from your wages

You'll have to pay extra fees for the enforcement agents on top of what you already owe.

What enforcement agents cannot do

Enforcement agents must follow strict rules. They cannot:

  • Force their way into your home
  • Take things that belong to someone else
  • Take things you need for work (up to a value of ¬£1,350)
  • Take things you need for basic living (like your cooker or fridge)
  • Visit between 9pm and 6am

If you think an enforcement agent has broken the rules, contact us immediately.

Taking money from your wages or benefits

Attachment of earnings

If you're working, we can ask the court to take money directly from your wages. Your employer will deduct the amount and send it to us.

Deductions from benefits

If you receive certain benefits, we can ask the Department for Work and Pensions to take money from your benefits to pay your council tax.

Prison

As a last resort, we can ask the magistrates' court to send you to prison for up to 3 months if you refuse to pay and can afford to pay.

This is very rare. We only do this when someone deliberately won't pay, not when they can't afford to pay.

Get help now

If you're struggling to pay your council tax, contact us today. The sooner you talk to us, the more options we have to help.

Remember: We want to help you pay in a way that's affordable for you.

Call 01452 396396 Email us
